website_summaries.verdict: From a well-respected name in bathroom fixtures and accessory design. Elongated toilet seat with many convenience features for using and cleaning, available in 9 tasteful colors.
pros: Trademark "Quiet-Close" lid closes slowly and without slamming
Quick-Release hinges enable toilet seat to pop off effortlessly, making hinge area easily accessible for cleaning
cons: Although this toilet seat is quite popular, there were mixed reviews regarding its comfort  and durability

customer_reviews.title: LIKE SITTING ON A RAZOR BLADE
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. Everything in my house is Kohler so I was quite surprised when our new addition bathroom toilet came without a toilet seat. I ordered this recommended unit and was shocked at how unusable it is. The seat is designed to fit the toilet and not the human body. It's like sitting on an oval razor blade. The inside seat ring itself is too narrow, I ended up taking the seat off the Kohler toilet in our guest room and using it. That one came with the same toilet and it is perfect. HEY KOHLER......IF IT AIN'T BROKE, DON'T FIX IT. Your line is too high end for this foolishness.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: The toilet seat broke within a weak. The cover and seat broke off from the knobs that allow it to open and close. Very upset waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Esmeralda Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: The Cadillac of the plumbing industry has really fallen down in this case.
customer_reviews.text: Summary, Koehler Slow Close Toilet Seat bought two • 19 February 2019 • Broken parts • Flimsy Design Installed the 1st one and all was good till I tried to slip it on to the mounting- One leg of the nylon mount broke. Ok, will send back and get another, but the 2nd on had a broken screwcap cover right out of the package Geez, swapped the cover from the previously broken one- it took two to make one good one. Unfortunately I need at least one right now, or I would send both back! Comparable Bemis, American made, was twice as expensive- guess you get what you pay for. I will call 800 number tomorrow and complain.
customer_reviews.author: llimpy

customer_reviews.title: Not Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good unfortunately this seat is not very comfortable compared to others we have owned. It has a weird shape. In retrospect you can actually see in the picture how the seat slants down at a steep angle towards the center of the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: jm1212

customer_reviews.title: Seat is lovely but won't install!
customer_reviews.text: The hardware associated with this product was impossible for this 61 yr old disabled female to install on her toilet, when she has done it in the past easily with other brands! The plastic connectors were too large to fit through the porcelain openings of the seat slots and while they may have gone in with a hammer, it might have also fractured the toilet! I am now out $31.82 plus tax and VERY disgruntled at the bad engineering presented by Kohler, a brand that used to be fantastic and a main-stay in my States' manufacturing. I should have known when they left us, that I shouldn't ever buy from them again. GRRR.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be seated.
customer_reviews.text: There are two primary choices in brand for these automatic mousetrap toilet seats. After a thorough and exhausting period of use for both, we have replaced them to all to be Kohler. The K brand is plastic, the other is wood. One would think the other brand is better, but this one just fits better, in every functional manner. Either brand is better than the old slammin' seat, but the Kohler is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: susie q

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: JUNK. Had 6 of these brand new when we built our home. 5 of the 6 cracked within 5 years. One was in a guest room that has almost never been used. I bought this particular new one before I realized I had so many others with hairline cracks. They are junk. Kohler should be ashamed. Kohler is a very rich company, family, etc. Selling crap like these to get richer is abominable. I just ordered four more made by somebody else, and won't go back to Kohler for anything, ever.
customer_reviews.author: CEC3

customer_reviews.title: If you have boys in your house, you need this seat!
customer_reviews.text: First watch the video that shows how this seat works - the snap-off feature is a life saver. I have young boys and their aim is not great, in fact, it's terrible. The old seat was so hard to keep clean and it kept coming loose. This one pops right off so I can easily clean the bowl and I throw the seat in the tub and clean it off. So much easier. It also stays put and doesn't come loose. I liked it so much I immediately ordered a second one for my toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Gaige

customer_reviews.title: Pronounced edge hurts my hamstrings
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy install, slow close, sturdy (you can sit on the closed lid and it doesn’t buckle). Kohler toilets are amazing. Seats, well, I guess that depends on your butt shape, leg thickness, pooping style. Cons: Edge of seat is very pronounced. Having awful cramping in my hamstrings. I probably sit for too long looking at my phone enjoying my daily constitutional. I should be comfortable doing so. If your looking for a training aid that will force you to spend less time sitting on the toilet, this is the seat for you. Came with a mar across the top. Possibly from shipping. Will return if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this seat.
customer_reviews.text: We were concerned, at first, because our bowl measurements weren't adding up to the recommended length on this toilet seat. We have a Kohler bowl, but it measures about 1/2 inch shorter than this seat. We didn't want it overlapping that would look awful. The seller encouraged us to buy this and try it (or they would, of course, refund the cost) and it fit perfectly. It closes slowly and very quietly (silent actually). Highly recommend this seat. 1 more added note: I can sit on the top lid and it doesn't buckle like my old seat did and I weigh around 195lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Why do some people feel this seat is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the idea of the grip tight bumpers but was a little worried when some people complained that the seat was not comfortable. So I was wondering if it was the contour of the seat but no it’s very rounded and smooth. The difference of this seat is the hole in the middle is larger then most other seats I’ve used. Since I have a small butt it was very noticeable and I thought I might fall through but that can’t happen. My wife has a bigger butt and didn’t even notice I replaced it. Anyway for us it’s not a big deal because we’re vegans and don’t spend much time sitting on it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The Kohler quick release toilet seat stays in place
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a toilet seat that I didn’t have to unscrew long screws in order to clean. This toilet seat it great. You assemble the screws into the toilet and then snap on the seat. Simply unsnap and remove to clean. There are tight grip bumpers that hold the seat firmly in place. I have not experienced any wobbly seat. The finish resists chips and scratches. The toilet seat lifts quietly and lowers slowly and quietly Be sure to know if your toilet is round or elongated. I purchased the elongated by mistake but I still love it
customer_reviews.author: Flower

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, Not so great in practice....
customer_reviews.text: Pretty thin and very light plastic seat. The latching and unlatching system seemed like a great idea but wound up being "not". The seats tend to come "unlatched" when you shift your weight to either side while "sitting". The little rubber slides/stops are supposed to stop that and if they were twice their size that would probably help. The seat tends to sit crooked on the toilet after a few uses and the little plastic "flip lids" at the hinges are flipping open from the flexing of the seat....fyi....I'm 5'10 and 175 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: darrell cox

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: Over all ok with this seat. However, I’m not sure why they think it would worth the price they marked it for. Bought it because it was on sale, but even when it was on sale, it was still $5 more expensive than what Home Depot has it for (other version). It’s a toilet seat, and I already installed it so I don’t want to take it off and return it just to get another one with $5 save. I’m ok with the seat, just kinda annoyed with how they brag about the seat in the advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: King Bee

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control on both I bought. Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: The “grip tight bumpers” on -both- of the two I bought came out of the bottom part of the seat. And apparently got flushed. After just a few weeks. Really really really annoying. A warranty issue now but who wants to go through that hassle for a poorly manufactured item. Also not very easy to clean. Lots of places require a toothbrush. The underside of both pieces were clearly not designed with cleanliness in mind.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kimb

customer_reviews.title: good value but you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: i still think that it is a good buy for the money BUT... After less than a year, one of the plastic screws that holds the seat to the toilet itself broke. i hardly played with it, if at all AND the replacement is not universal so after wasting my money at the local hard-store, i had to order on Amazon - double the price. the seat itself, oppose to the cover, does not stay in open position - all the way back. you have to hold it all the way back for few seconds for it to stay. Note:: we did not abuse it ion any way. only two "normal" weight people with no kids.
customer_reviews.author: kumer

customer_reviews.title: quiet closing. seat comes off when you want it to - or when you don't.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this seat because its quiet-close feature reduces noise in the middle of the night. it does that well. the seat is also designed for easy removal. i don't think this is an essential feature, unless you live with some very sloppy people. and that easy-removal means that the seat can come off when you would prefer it stays in place. also, it is impossible to pass a rag under the hinge area, so complete cleaning *requires*you to remove the seat - not necessarily my preference. the all-plastic seat material will probably remain cleanable longer than painted wood, but plastic seats are not solid-feeling compared to wood. overall, i'd buy something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: sophocles

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the quick-release. Lasted only 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: The quick-release might seem like it is a good selling point, but it is also the literal weak point of this toilet seat. At first I thought my wife was somehow abusing the seat because it would occasionally pop off where it snaps in. Now the gray part in the no slam area has come off and the lid has fallen off. Looking at how they designed the quick-release you'll see how it can quickly wear out. The two prongs become stretched out and no longer securely stay. 2 years later here I am shopping for a replacement and giving you a warning that you should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: R. Will

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken when installing.
customer_reviews.text: This seat comes with a hard plastic screw to attach the seat to the toilet. Unfortunately, the choice of this particular plastic almost ensures a failed installation as simply trying to screw it on breaks the part. The threads are not deep enough to recover from losing the plastic tooth that came off, so no way to fix it. Slick design, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Ty

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable but pretty and silent.
customer_reviews.text: This seat is extremely uncomfortable. If you have to sit on it yourself you might want to look for a different model. It was easy to install. It's very attractive. It is an incredibly lightweight polymer but it does appear to be durable. I love the No Slam feature. My last toilet seat also had a No Slam but my kids were able to circumvent the mechanism so to speak. This one works great and so far forcing it closed does not seem to affect it's performance in any way. My children age 6 and 8 do not seem to think it is very uncomfortable but I think it is absolutely painful.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bc my last one's cover is missing—the old one's completely rotten for the screw. It took me a couple of hours to take it off (eventually used a saw to cut the screw, horrible!) I'm impressed that this one uses plastic that the same problem wouldn't happen again. Very thoughtful! Easy to install and use. I like the soft-close that I don't have to bang the seat, everyone could hear it. Make it lasts longer too. So far, nothing to complain at all! Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Yy

customer_reviews.title: Not Ideal
customer_reviews.text: If you look, almost every toilet seat on Amazon has at least a few bad reviews for being uncomfortable and/or flimsy. I would actually pay more for quality, but none of the seats I read reviews on instilled much confidence. So I settled on this Kohler with mostly good reviews. It's okay, but it turns out it actually is cheap looking and really is quite uncomfortable. Its beveled downwards so that you sort of center down into it. I've never encountered this before. I feel like every toilet seat I've ever sat on has pretty much been the same. Its impressive the amount of calories it must've taken to screw that up. My recommendation is to keep shopping
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable ridge on the seat.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this particular toilet seat because it is made from plastic. (The wooden seats that are painted all seem to retain stains). On the positive side, the toilet seat is easy to install, to clean, and seems sturdy. On the negative side, the seat itself is very uncomfortable. You can see in the product picture that the outer edger of the seat is much higher than the inner portion of the seat. This creates a strange ridge outline that digs into your body when you sit on the seat. (Most toilet seats have this type of angle, but none is as pronounced as this one.)
customer_reviews.author: HowManyStars

customer_reviews.title: Very nice seat... BUT....
customer_reviews.text: I just installed the Kohler K-4636-0 toilet seat. I really like the quiet-close seat and the grip-tight bumpers... and it installed perfectly. BUT... this is, easily, the most uncomfortable toilet seat and I have ever sat on. I'm not sure what the designers were thinking when they came up with the shape of this seat... it has a hard, curved edge that simply does not fit the human anatomy. It's pretty... but, certainly, not designed for comfort. I would not think of returning a toilet seat after installing it, so I will just live with this for awhile until I can find a more comfortable solution.
customer_reviews.author: Joe West

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable to sit on; not quite long enough for Kohler toilet
customer_reviews.text: I can only describe the angle of the actual set as "funnel shaped". If you look carefully you can even see it in the photo. Not very nice to sit on. Also, it did not quite fit our Kohler elongated toilet leaving some of the toilet basin exposed in the front. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Ill-shaped and cheaply constructed.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a big fan of Kohler for 45 years. This is not the Kohler seat of yore. I ended up sending it back after installation because it wouldn't go on straight even with professional installation. The fasteners and brackets seemed really cheap and flimsy. The worst part was the shape and design. Apparently Kohler didn't use normal humans in the shaping process. I can't imagine who could ever comfortably sit on this thing. Fortunately, as I was throwing out the old one, I discovered that it was only a pin that had slid out of place, so I fixed it and re-installed it. Welcome back!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roof

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's just a humble toilet seat. But it's a necessity. This one fits well, doesn't slide around and doesn't bang when the lid is shut. I'd never installed a toilet seat before and was apprehensive about trying it. I did have to call ;the company for help about one small step that wasn't clear to me. The representative explained it quickly and courteously. I'm pleased with both the product and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Mae

customer_reviews.title: Seat comes down on its own
customer_reviews.text: For my toilet, the seat comes down when it shouldn’t. It could be because the tank part is too big and so the seat isn’t able to open back far enough to stay open (just a random possibility). I added a video to show the behavior. This may not happen with other toilets but I figured it’s still worth mentioning. I can see this being a problem if you have male guests over who start going and then the seat starts coming down...could get messy...
customer_reviews.author: Hodge Podge

customer_reviews.title: All toilet seats are the same. NOPE
customer_reviews.text: I renovated my mother's bathroom last month and removed a ridiculously heavy seat which always seemed to slam shut. The sound was like a gunshot and very unsettling. I bought this product on a lark. A toilet seat is a toilet seat, right? Just as long as it didn't slam it was alright with me. It was insanely easy to install, size, and it's closing was so smooth and quiet that I found myself in amazement. Many times I found myself carefully closing it when there was never a need. When I got back home I immediately bought one for myself. Beautiful, stylish and quiet, it was one of those lucky purchases that's a joy to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seat great! hardware unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The seat is great. I gave it four stars because of the installation hardware. Installation is easy due to the split connectors that initially just push on the bolt attachment. This is supposed to leave you with just a couple turns of the screwdriver to complete the installation. After using the toilet seat for a week or so, the connectors come loose and you have to retighten them. The split connector is a nice idea to simplify installation but they do not stay tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good slow close seat for long bowl
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for the same seat (although slightly earlier model based on the changes in attachment hardware) that had been in use for 10 years before the slow-close mechanism stopped working and finally the hinge cracked apart. Removal of the old seat, cleaning around the hinge mount, and installing the new one only took a few minutes. Seat is definitively worth while to avoid banging when someone drops the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Delbert Matlock

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I've changed toilet seats before, ok maybe 1 but it's very simple. The instructions that came with thing were useless. I just could not figure out how to attach it! The screws and flaps would not lay flat for me to screw it in. I'm like WTF! I finally YouTube it and still no help. Went back on here to read the reviews and no one said anything bout having the same issues. It was then I read the instructions and looked at the pix HERE. Omg lol. So..follow the instructions here on under this product and you will be done in 5 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: When my bathroom door is open, it comes extremely close to hitting the front of my toilet. We had concern that with a new toilet seat/lid, it would it the door, and the door would need to be sanded down in that spot and re-painted. When I first installed the seat, it just barely hit the door, stopping it from going any farther. However, there's an adjustment you can make with the screw/seat attachment that allows you to move the seat forward or backward slightly. This was just enough for the seat to not hit the door! That was a surprise feature. We already enjoy the slow close and sturdiness. Works perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable seat ing the house.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old wooden seat with metal hinges that eventually got all grody and rusty. I have always preferred the wood seats until now. I like how easy this is to keep clean, no rusty gross hinges and like the way you can remove it for a proper cleaning. Much more sanitary. It took a few sittings to get used the contour shape of the seat, but I now am quite happy and comfortable when reading my favorite bathroom magazines. Best seat in the house! Now I just need a television...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C

customer_reviews.title: Creates high anxiety for sudden lid detachment!
customer_reviews.text: The lid will NOT stay on and we have know idea why?! If you so much as touch the lid to start the soft close portion of this highly recommended seat, the side lid latches snap inside and the whole lid pops off unexpectedly leading to a near heart attack!! Why, Kohler, WHY?! Please help us by either replacing it or refunding does I can purchase another seat. We’ve only had this one for 2 days and I stay anxious just waiting for the stupid lid to scare me to death again!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable, very narrow seat
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat has very narrow edges to sit on. I wouldn't recommend it for children at all bc they will probably end up falling into the toilet since the hole in the toilet seat is almost the same as the toilet without a toilet seat on it. I literally lean forward to prevent from falling in myself and I am 5'5.5, 170 pounds. I don't think most adults would appreciate balancing to prevent themselves from falling in but it doesn't bother me enough to change it again.
customer_reviews.author: Genny

customer_reviews.title: Great install, sturdy, but not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We needed a replacement seat because ours was really scratched up and kinda junky looking. Embarrassing. This Kohler seat was a good price and a great install and I love the soft close so that it can't be slammed or fall loudly. However, it is not comfortable. I think it is because the seat surface slopes at an angle toward the toilet bowl center. This is not for the master bath, so it's not a huge issue, but when I look for another replacement, I will look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Toilet Seat
customer_reviews.text: You won't find a better toilet seat that this one; quickly installed and works like a charm. The lid closes gently without any sound, it's strong and stays in perfect place after installation. If we needed to replace another one in our home, this would be the one we'd purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine L. Snesrud

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand all the great reviews for this product
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the great reviews for this product. While I do appreciate the soft close lid (no slamming) the way the seat is made is very uncomfortable to sit on. The outside edges of the seat are raised which puts pressure no matter how you sit. The underneath of the seat is curved inward making it harder to clean than a flat surface. The bottom portion of the seat is molded thinly, I do not see this holding up very long without cracking. But this is the risk for buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Anita K Geisler

customer_reviews.title: eazy installation
customer_reviews.text: the shape and angles are totally different than the old seat. I bought this as an upgrade and wonder if it was a right choice. It does have the rubber mounts that hold the seat in place, but only in the front not in 4 places as the video shows. It does not move around so maybe they decided two worked just as good. The back part of the hinge where it attaches to the bolts does look very thin so I decided not to tell my wife you can pull the seat out to clean it because I am sure it will be a weak spot.
customer_reviews.author: F. A. Salas

customer_reviews.title: Dark plastic markings in front of toilet seat that can not be washed off or removed!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could exchange this for one that one that wasn't defective! It's a great toilet seat, easy to assemble, but I bought it in November and it said it has a one year warranty, but it's listed as "refund/exchange ended" and it's been only six months. The green plastic spots started about a month after I bought the seat and it's impossible to wash off. Looks terrible. Hopefully, someone will read this and help me get a replacement (assuming this one is just defective)
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I was replacing a Kohler 75796-0 Cachet Nightlight that my son managed to break. The 7596-0 wasn't available except from scammers asking 2-3x the msrp. Luckily I fond that this seat is identical, except it doesn't' include the electronic board from the nightlight version. This seat does include a "hole" where the nightlight board can go, so I just put the board from the nightlight version into this one! It works perfectly. Slow close etc.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Quality control problem and lid edge is sharp
customer_reviews.text: Overall worked as advertised. Bought 3 of these toilet seat covers and had to exchange one due to long scratch mark on the seat. The package was fine so must be quality control problem. Few weeks later I cut my hand pretty bad while lifting up one of the toilet seat cover. Upon inspection found the front edge of the lid is sharp on right front side. So Instead of exchanging again, I decided to filed it down and that solved the problem. I probably would buy again but definitely will inspect the product more carefully before using it...
customer_reviews.author: JJ Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice and durable seat
customer_reviews.text: My mom has partial Paralysis so she tends to put quit a bit of force onto toilet seats. I’ve had 2 break and the second one more recently, ever since she recently moved in. I decided to get this one about 5 months ago. I knew I needed something that wouldn’t keep breaking; let me remind you my mom weighs about 270 pounds. I waited awhile to do a review because I wanted to see how long this toilet seat would last without breaking it’s still in GREAT CONDITION and it’s over all a SUPER NICE ELEGANT SEAT and it is also SUPER DURABLE.
customer_reviews.author: Hilario

customer_reviews.title: Not at all comfortable when sitting on it.
customer_reviews.text: The lid is plastic. It is the most uncomfortable toilet seat i've ever sat on. The design on the seat part is contoured and we feel like we are going to fall in the toilet. Would never, ever buy "cachet" style seat again. Total waste of hard earned money. I really did not realize what I ordered until it came in. We tried it, but I removed it and ordered a conventional wood seat that is much, much better.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Like sitting inside a bucket
customer_reviews.text: This is a great seat for install, cost and material. This is not a great seat to sit on. The angle from the outside edge of the seat to the inside is so steep it is like sitting inside of a bucket. Why on earth it angled is beyond me, but for small children it means sitting on a decline and having to balance to not fall backward. Perhaps it is that steep of an angle to let urine roll off and into the toilet but for me I have no need of such a feature.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Wolski

customer_reviews.title: You deserve this seat
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a seat that didn't loosen up over time, this is working out perfectly. No complaints whatsoever. I like the quiet close lid feature, and the quick detach for cleaning. Feels solid, I would recommend this seat, I'm not sure why I waited so long to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Balance with sturdiness of wooden but features and resilience of plastic
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, replacing a similarly priced plastic Bemis seat and a more expensive wooden seat. The Kohler is much more sturdy and has very little flex for a plastic seat. When closed and you push on the top it feels solid almost like a wooden seat. It's comfortable and the rubber grips ensure it does not slide. The slow close is very slow and quiet. The wooden slow close would still make quiet a bit of noise when making contact. Definitely recommended as it's as nice balance with sturdiness of wooden but features and resilience of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: steReveiew

customer_reviews.title: Good seat. Will not work with a bidet attachment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this seat to change an old one that was working with a bidet attachment. This seat will not work with the bidet. The hinge angle will not go back enough without the front of the lid hanging about an inch in the air. I had to swap toilet seats with my second bathroom for the time being and now must order another seat for my bathroom toilet. The feature that lets you pull the seat off without removing the screws looks and feels like it might snap and break if you use this feature a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Malcamar

customer_reviews.title: better than standard seats, we think
customer_reviews.text: My wife does not like the way the standard wood-product toilet seats tend to fade and stain, so we went specifically for a plastic seat with easy to clean features, and this brand and model fit the bill. My wife and I are very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement covers - super easy to install - follow the measurement directions
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for covers that broke in two separate bathrooms (literally a day apart - these had been purchased at a box box store where the quality of toilet covers is not so great in my opinion). Much more sturdy than I expected and fits well. Super easy to install (make sure you measure according to instructions and then again when you get the product, confirm from the measurement on the outside of the box. The top closes slowly but it works. Takes a time or two to get used to opening it all the way at first since it is not loose like other models but works well. Good buy. Nice look.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but not functional.
customer_reviews.text: The quick release seat would come loose without trying to release it & the cap over one of the bolts would pop of almost every time I'd close the cover. I removed the bolt & re-installed the seat twice to no avail. The set curves inward this is not comfortable for a guy. The quiet close top closes to slowly. After several month I replaced it with (You will not believe this.) another Kohler. KOHLER has a better model but I don't have the model number. The seat is flatter, with regular screw mounts & the top appear to close faster.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Installed 3 of these in about 20 minutes. My singing isnt included ;)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these and replaced all seats in my house. I thought that the slow closing seats would keep things quiet at night. All 3 seats total, took me about 20 minutes to install. If you can hold a plastic nut and screw a metal bolt with a Philips head screwdriver, you can install this. My "lovely " singing (video I attagxed) and sound effects are not Included.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: The seat slopes in
customer_reviews.text: The seat slopes inward. So when you sit your butt down the seat is not flat and you feel like your falling into a funnel. That does not work for me. I want to sit flat on the seat. Otherwise, the slow close works pretty well. If you do not lift the lid fully the slow close does not seem to work as well and will slam shut. There are other models that seem to work better. I am going to return this and get a different one.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations - Quality is good for the price pait.
customer_reviews.text: It's a toilet seat that does its job. The soft-close is somewhat slow, but I guess it's doing what it should. Be aware the the hole in the seat seems unusually large - larger than most that I've seen. My wife commented on it the first day, but then my elementary-aged daughter said that she felt like she was falling in the toilet. I suppose this may be a benefit if larger people are using it, but something to be aware of for more slender or smaller people.
customer_reviews.author: John Q Public

customer_reviews.title: BUY TWO! Or as many as you need to replace all of your toilet seats
customer_reviews.text: (At the risk of sounding weird and reviewing a bathroom toilet seat, this is a great invention!) This is Kohler, so, it's a quality product. This was on sale, so, I thought I'd take the risk. The auto-lowering function is a spoiler. When you're through, you give the seat or lid a gentle tug, and, it does the rest: quickly and QUIETLY. It's great! It saves time and effort. Unfortunately, this conditions you to become accustomed to minimum effort. I started accidentally slamming the other, manual toilet seat. Dang. Now I've got to get one for the other bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: TAAMinator

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE, BUT CHEAP HINGE PINS
customer_reviews.text: This Kohler Soft-Close Lid works well and looks nice, -- but the plastic hinge pins are fragile, and won't last very long before you end up spending some $25 for a Replacement Hinge Assembly, when all you need is a 25¢ Hinge Pin. OR for some $13 more you can buy a WHOLE BRAND NEW Soft-Close commode seat. And some people might forget buying Kohler and ending up with something that is better designed!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Elegant and inexpensive; bought Used, like new Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to get discounted items this way and save lots of money. Box was only minimally damaged and still sealed, and seat was undamaged. I really think excess items are discounted. In any case, I bought this and countless discounted items. This soft close beveled lid looks nice with the comfort height toilets we just purchased. The hinges are secure and seat doesn't move when sitting on it. Additionally, I prefer this one over wood toilet because they're easy to clean, dont stain as easily as wood, and doesn't harbor germs as badly as wood. I'm sold! Getting 3 more for our other bathrooms.
customer_reviews.author: TROTTERS

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing!
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the market for a slow closing toilet seat for a while - but the price was never right. These are PERFECT. I'm very sensitive to sounds, so when someone slams the toilet seat, it makes me go crazy. But not anymore! The installation was extremely easy. The comfort is very similar to the seat we had before, so there wasn't much to adjust to. And the slow close - obviously, 100% satisfaction there.
customer_reviews.author: Cyanide_Martyr

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Wait So Long?!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. I do not like the plastic material, yet I think that is how many toilet seats are made these days(??). As others mentioned, the fit needs some work. Overall though, it is a tremendous upgrade from what I had - I wish that I did not wait so long. It is amazing the difference a few small investments can make in increasing the enjoyment of and pride in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great seat, buy your own fasteners for the hinges
customer_reviews.text: The product itself works as advertised. I was replacing a toilet seat that kept moving, wasn’t secured well. I installed per directions. The fastener the screw goes into (idk the technical name) was stripped. On both. There was 0% chance to tighten down the screw to keep it secured. Luckily, I had not thrown out the old fasteners from the previous seat, so I cleaned them and used these, and that made it 100% sturdy and unmoving. I guess I was surprised that Kohler would cheap out on that part. The toilet itself is Kohler, so I wanted a Kohler seat. Anyways, if I bought this again, I’d go to Home Depot to buy better fasteners for it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smolen

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for where we used it.
customer_reviews.text: It closes very slowly so you have to give it a bit of a push so you don't have to stand around and wait to flush the toilet. It has a pretty good slope downward from the outer seat rim to the inner rim, so a little uncomfortable when you sit on it until you get used to it. Lastly, the plastic has cracked considerably on the seat. It doesn't penetrate the glossy coating and therefore you can't feel it but you can certainly see it.
customer_reviews.author: Orianna

customer_reviews.title: This works well and is of great quality
customer_reviews.text: We have a smaller toilet, however the old lid was way to wide inhibiting free moving bodily parts. Now we have plenty space when sitting and it went on really quickly and firmly. It does however hang out a bit in front but still has no issue with the special grips on the bottom of the lid so all is well. Feel confident in buying this quality lid. Have a great time creating a splash!!
customer_reviews.author: Greco G

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made, nice finish, and operates well.
customer_reviews.text: The finish is nice, and seems sturdy. My toilet is now American Kohlard. Only some will understand. Not sure why some others were complaining about the comfort. (I'm about 210lbs) I find no issues with that. Installed quickly.
customer_reviews.author: wsp II

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been waiting forever to replace my toilet seat because I have a skirted toilet, then I found this one. I’m a single girl, trying to be as handy as I can be on my own and after I watched the videos, I bought the toilet seat. It took me more time to remove the old seat verses installing this new one. I’m about to go in for spine surgery and updating several things before I go down. It is a little narrow, so I see why people say it’s not the most comfortable seat. Meh, I’m hoping not to hang out here too long to notice.
customer_reviews.author: Justagirlinnyc

customer_reviews.title: Please list what’s actually wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the description saying small cosmetic flaw on the top or bottom the toilet seat but what was wrong was it was missing the bolts. My husband is now super upset because he had to run to Home Depot to find the special bolts which don’t fit. So now he has to drill out their hardware because their special properitary bolts to make the only ones close enough at Home Depot to fit and taking an hour of his time to install this. I wouldn’t have ordered this if I knew parts were missing. Please indicate what is actually wrong and not just a minor a scuff. Sad! 😢
customer_reviews.author: Patti Jones

customer_reviews.title: Worse is the cheap type 304 stainless mounting screw set ...
customer_reviews.text: so my house has three American Standard toilets with their original toilet seats after 40 years. Yet my 105 lb daughter's bathroom has a 1.6g Kohler toilet and I have had to replace the seat twice already. Worse is the cheap type 304 stainless mounting screw set in an aluminum expansion collar corroded to point of needed to be replaced in just 8 years. Had to buy a $25 dollar screw kit to replace a $28 seat. Conclusion Kohler products are cheaply made and am seriously considering ripping out this $300 toilet simply to avoid replacing a toilet seat every 4 years.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Will

customer_reviews.title: Nice toilet seat and look, comfortable, broken hardware
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent toilet seat for the money. It's comfortable and nice looking. Both lids close slowly, it's pretty cool. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because one of the attaching plastic hardware nuts was broken, as if the hardware packet had been stepped on. So, keep your old hardware from your old seat, you may need it as in my case. Also, ensure the plastic tab covers are snapped down over the mounting bolts, and that the rubber cushions are installed at the bottom of the seat otherwise the toilet seat will slide side to side and may sit you on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Frank White

customer_reviews.title: was reluctant based on some reviews...go ahead it works well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a bidet (Tushy) which is also fantastic and decided to change the seat as well....This works well with the bidet and really like that the lid does not slam...sturdy and doesn't "shift" around when on it!
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Poor comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars on almost everything. However, the seat design is not comfortable at all. If you cRe about seat comfort, then you wont like the funnel like shape of this seat. It even is raised at the front where your legs rest and causes circulation issues causing your legs to become numb and or tingle (akagoing to sleep). Would line to return, but do not have the original packaging. Currently shopping for a replacement and will discard this one. $30 dollars down the pot so to speK.
customer_reviews.author: L. O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: My tushy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I never imagined I’d be this excited about a toilet seat. I’ve had horrible ones in the past that were in the same price range as this one. This one is AMAZING! Super sturdy and very comfy for my tush! I didn’t know what I was missing until I installed this one. P.S. Maybe this is TMI but the way this is shaped, it reduces the creases on your bum if you happen to sit for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hurts your butt
customer_reviews.text: I'm not overweight (6'2" and 200 lbs). My wife is on the small side. Both of us think the seat angle (the slope from the outer edge to the inside edge) is too step and thus puts a pressure point on the outside of your legs. It's better than sitting on a 5 gallon bucket but not a lot better. If I didn't feel stupid for returning a used toilet seat I would. I have never experienced this kind of problem on any toilet seat I have ever used in my 53 years. I mean how hard is it to design a toilet seat? Seriously, how hard is it?
customer_reviews.author: NorrisFreak

customer_reviews.title: F this toilet seat.
customer_reviews.text: I have IBS, if that is TMI, I apologize, but I’m often in the restroom. Someone mentioned that being on this toilet seat is as comfortable as being on a razor, or squatting on a bucket. I COMPLETELY AGREE. I don’t know how you can mess up a toilet seat, but they manage to do so. THE SEAT LITERALLY CURVES IN, AND DIGS INTO YOUR FLESH. I’ll be making another purchase at Lowe’s or Home Depot to replace this garbage. I’d rather eat glass then deal with this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but a pain in the butt...
customer_reviews.text: This seat looks great on our Kohler Memoirs toilet, but boy it's a pain in the you know what...literally! I now have piriformis syndrome, which means this muscle irritates the sciatic nerve, and this seat which slopes inward toward the bowl aggravates the condition immensely. My spouse who does not have any, "bum" muscle/nerve issues also finds the shape painful to sit on for any length of time. We would like the rounded shape of a wood seat, but in plastic...not sure if this exists. Otherwise this seat has held up quite well for the 4 years we've had it, but can't give it more than 2-stars due to the pain it creates.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Siow

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with hairline crack and divot and missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a divot sunken look on one side where the bumpers are below and the othe side in the same area it had a very small hairline crack that you could barely notice. But I'm sure it woukd eventually break. Didn't matter because hardware was missing anyway. It was shipped it its own packaging without an additional box. Looks like it fell out... Returned
customer_reviews.author: BDR

customer_reviews.title: A great replacement seat
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a soft close toilet seat before. It's very nice. I put this in a guest bath. It was super simple to install. I followed the measuring instructions to be sure I got the right one. It cleans well and the silent close is nice. I'm sure it would be great for a house full of kids if you can actually get them to put the lid down, you'll enjoy the silence, at least from your new seat anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Girl

customer_reviews.title: Several imperfections in the molded seat
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like all the imperfections in the molded seats. Most were out of sign on the back of the seat, however at least one is visible. Thought the Kohler company had a good reputation. Will avoid their products in the future. Don't know how long the easy off toilet seat function will last as it is just plastic. The slow close seat function does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Dream

customer_reviews.title: Great For bathroom Used By Guests-No slamming Toilet Seats
customer_reviews.text: The one delivered had a little piece broken where lid attached to the seat. Amazon refunded me immediately. 😄 As I didn’t notice the defect until 20 minutes before the plumber was arriving, I had to make a mad dash out to brick & mortar to buy a replacement. Paid more, but didn’t want to pay for the plumber to return. I love this new seat. The slow closing lid is excellent. No more slamming lids from visitors. This is in my powderroom bath. I also bought the toliet on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: PLS - Bella Donna's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Kohler seat sturdy and easy but not for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: The new Kohler design has the unfortunate result of contouring one into a hole which is not only uncomfortable but counterproductive. It is easy to clean, easy to install, and sturdy. I am likely to go back to a flatter design instead of the contoured top towards the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest C. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Best toilet seat ever
customer_reviews.text: Was worried at first about how it was going to be easy to remove but at the same time sturdy. Works fantastically. Bolt cap serves as the extra secure function. It’s great to be able to remove the seat each time I want to clean it making sure the restroom is always clean. Would recommend this seat to anyone looking for a great quiet close toilet seat with added cleaning feature.
customer_reviews.author: Review in SD

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic Mounting Hardware - hassle
customer_reviews.text: The hardware that comes with the seat is cheap plastic. The nut is flimsy plastic that won’t stay tight. The threads from the metal mounting bold just don’t bite. After a long time on hold, Kohler agreed to send me better hardware for free - but it’s a 4-business day wait, and a hassle. The hardware for this seat is smaller diameter than the old toilet seat, so I couldn’t reuse it. I would NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P.

customer_reviews.title: Slow closing works great!  These are awesome!  Super easy to install, super easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved these seats! I can’t stand when the hubby or someone else slams the seat down! I feel like slamming their head in the toilet! LOL! Only thing is, with one of two that we ordered, the whole seat has to be held up when a “man” is using the bathroom! I guess it’s too heavy to keep itself up, I have no idea, but not gonna bother returning. Even though it is a little bit pricey! Still love them and definitely love the slow closing! Best thing ever made for bathroom toilets!
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: A Charm.
customer_reviews.text: Our 9 year old Kohler Comfort Height Elongated Quiet Close toilet (2nd same model is 7 years old) just had the lid plastic hinge damper pin break. Common? "Don't force it closed", some say. Lifting it is forcing too. How about don't put anything heavy on the lid? e.g. stand on it. The rim damper pin is metal. So happens this lid/rim solution here is only about $10 more than the Hinge Kit. And this rim has the Grip Tight bumpers to reduce any side motion. Understand, the plastic clips that snap down over the hold-down hardware have to be in place. These are essential for the seat stability. Will be buying another similar model Kohler for a 3rd bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best seat in the house!
customer_reviews.text: Okay this is the coolest, most functional toilet seat you can get! I bought this for my apt after dealing with a seat the would go side to side and never remain tight. The rubber to keep the seat in place work flawlessly and the ability to remove the seat with just a tug is AMAZING so you can clean around the seat 10x faster. Installment took just moments and I don’t see myself having to worry about tightening the seat for a long time! I genuinely look forward to sitting on the toilet now!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael A Medrano

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: My last seat was wood, heavy and built like a tank. It broke when the plastic hinges disintegrated and the enamel began wearing off the seat. It was less than a year old. This Koehler seat is light, thin and made of what I hope is a strong plastic. It’s comfortable for my somewhat overweight bottom and very stable with no sign of moving around. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Christiaan T.

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The problem is not with the seat it self it is with the hardware that came with it. The plastic nuts are a split design. They are made to come together and get closer together as they get screwed into the bottom of the toilet bowel. I guess my toilet was not made for this type of nut because it never gets tight. I didn't want to go to the trouble of returning the seat so used the bolt and nuts from the previous seat.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a household with kids
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our previous home. We love it so much that we had to purchased these again for our new house. We love how sturdy, nicely built and comfortable these are. It closes so softly when you let the lid go. Perfect if you have children that just slams it when closing the lid. Wouldn’t buy any other brand. Price is also affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Rafaele C.

customer_reviews.title: Clean, quiet - Make yourself happy
customer_reviews.text: This model is not stocked by Lowe’s/Home Depot in my area, but is a less expensive version. I could not find any design, material differences from what the big box stores carry. This is the second home where I’ve retrofitted with quiet close seats. The peace of mind having absolutely clean seats and the benefit of no accidental dropped seats is a big plus
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic set up, good quality, and the kids won't slam it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice toilet for sure good quality I like Kohler products. I mainly wanted to upgrade because the old toilet didn't let down easy in the kids always slammed it. Overall I give the seat a 5 stars but one thing to note, it is wide, so may be a little challenge for young kiddos who won't quite fit right or even fall in lol.
customer_reviews.author: murdog

customer_reviews.title: Much better products available on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The Mayfair Molded Wood seat available on Amazon Prime is 10X better quality at about the same price.This product is very cheep thin plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Treat yourself
customer_reviews.text: trust me, it's worth spending a few bucks to upgrade your toilet seat -- this one is super comfortable, easy to install, and the soft-close is great if you hate having the toilet seat slam down. I don't know why I waited so long, but seriously, think about the amount of time you spend sitting on the toilet each day -- this is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Read the material description...
customer_reviews.text: This seat is plastic. In all fairness that was my mistake, it clearly states it is plastic. I personally have never seen one made of plastic and didn't realize when I ordered. Call me old fashion but I'll stick with the composite wood if you please. If a plastic seat is not a deal killer for you then this should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Not clear instructions for the novice.
customer_reviews.text: This had terrible instructions. Perhaps if it wasn’t installed by a woman who never did this before it would have been easier for a knowledgeable man or woman. The verbage and inadequate illustrations which were fuzzy & minuscule were of no help. Please consider the novice who hasn’t done this before. Frustrating!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO KEEP CLEAN
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase because of the negative reviews that the toilet seat was uncomfortable. To be honest, I have no idea what they are talking about. These are as comfortable as any other toilet seat I have ever used! 😁 I like the soft close feature and are so much better than wood toilet seats. Very please with purchase and were easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jane B

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father who at 83 was having problems with the old seat sliding sideways when he went to sit down. This seat is much better, it has two soft grippers on the front "feet" of the seat which reduce the slipping. I also liked the fact that the mounting bolts are stainless steel and not plastic. The quality is pretty good, much better than the bargain seats, but not really a premium quality seat. Guess you gotta pay more than $35 for that. Oh Well, all-in-all I'm pretty pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Burkey

customer_reviews.title: Horrible uncomfortable design
customer_reviews.text: The seat slopes sharply down into the toilet like a funnel. My ass sinks down it. My legs fall asleep so fast, then I can't walk. This is the worst design I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Is it possible to love a toilet seat!?!?
customer_reviews.text: I love this toilet seat! Fit my American Standard toilet perfectly. I love that I can sit on the lid of the seat to do my daughters hair or help her brush her teeth and it doesn’t slide side to side. The slow close features it amazing! And I love that you can remove the seat to get a better clean. Very easy for me to assemble. Sturdy material. I’m a happy mama!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: A piece of junk. easy to install but the grip strips don't hold and the seat is not sturdy at all. Amazing KOHLER does not put their name on the junky item. It is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: 5/7 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars! It was white (as advertised) so it perfectly matched my toilet. Easy to install, comes with all necessary hardware, fit perfectly and, best of all... you CANNOT slam this pup!! Gone are the nights when your spouse/offspring/one-night-stand/dog wakes you from your blissful slumber with the sounds of a crash-landing plastic seat. Sweet dreams, everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Starke

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I had this toilet seat for less than 5 months and not only had the top come off but the part connecting the actual seat to the toilet broke as well. Worked great for a while then weight broke. Not sure if it's a manufacturing issue but for that price it should last. Especially since this is my lesser used second bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Valler

product_meta.title: KOHLER K-4636-0 Cachet Elongated White Toilet Seat, with Grip-Tight Bumpers, Quiet-Close Seat, Quick-Release Hinges, Quick-Attach Hardware, No Slam Toilet Seat, White
product_meta.description:
Designed to fit most elongated toilets, this cachet seat combines subtle styling and innovative technology. Unique grip tight bumpers hold the seat firmly in place and prevent shifting. This soft close seat features innovative technology that prevents the seat from slamming and simplifies both cleaning and installation.

AMAZON.COM


With subtle styling and innovative technology, the Kohler Cachet seat fits most elongated toilets and features uniquely designed rubber bumpers that hold the seat firmly in place and prevent shifting. This Kohler Q3 Advantage seat features innovative technology that prevents slamming and simplifies both cleaning and installation.

Kohler's Quiet-Close hinges prevent the seat 
from slamming (view larger). KOHLER K-4636 CACHET ELONGATED TOILET SEAT
AT A GLANCE:
 * Fits elongated one- and two-piece toilets
   
   
 * Quiet-Close prevents the lid from slamming and increases safety
   
   
 * Quick-Release allows easy access for cleaning
   
   
 * Stain- and fade-resistant solid polypropylene
   
   
 * 1-year limited warranty

The seat is ergonomically contoured for maximum user comfort and fits one- and two-piece toilets. Made of solid polypropylene, the Cachet is resistant to staining, fading, and chipping. It's backed by a 1-year limited warranty. The Cachet is also available in a round-front design.

Q3 ADVANTAGE DESIGN
Kohler's Q3 Advantage toilet seats are specially engineered to ensure a proper fit, with subtle styling to complement a wide variety of toilet designs. Innovative features include technology that prevents lids from slamming and seats that remove easily for cleaning. 

The Cachet Quiet-Close toilet seat with Quick-Release functionality is engineered to close with the slightest touch, reducing unwanted noise often associated with lid slamming. Additionally, it offers improved hygiene as you only need to make minimal contact with the seat or lid for it to begin to gently close.

By removing the toilet seat, you can fully clean around the seat hinges, and in the case of two-piece toilets you can easily get around the area where the tank meets the bowl--places where dirt can accumulate and that are not readily accessible with a standard bolt toilet seat. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Kohler Cachet elongated toilet seat; installation instructions

Quick-Release technology allows the seat to be removed for easy cleaning (view larger). 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Quiet-Close functionality eliminates slamming and increases hygiene and safety. Quick-Release functionality allows the seat to be removed easily from the toilet allowing for convenient cleaning. Engineered to ensure a proper fit with subtle styling to complement toilets of many different designs. Made of solid polypropylene and is resistant to stains. Elongated seat design to fit elongated bowls.

See more
feature_bullets: Quiet close lid closes slowly and quietly without slamming
Grip tight bumpers add stability and prevent shifting
Quick release hinges allow seat to be unlatched from toilet for easy removal and convenient cleaning; No tools required
Quick attach hardware for fast and secure installation

specifications.Included Components: Installation Instructions, Kohler Cachet Elongated Toilet Seat
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,231 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
